resources.string: Thank you for partecipating in the experiment. You may now leave. Please alert the experimenter that you are done.
Total number of cards selected from each deck
You can not save PDF\nPNG file will be saved

You are about to take part in an experiment on decision making. You will start with a $2000 loan. On each trial, you will select a card from one of four decks. After you select each card, you will be given a reward and possibly be required to pay penalty. Your goal is to maximize the profit on your loan, and you may choose any deck at any time to do so. Touch to continue

You are about to take part in an experiment on decision making. For each card you draws, you will get a reward. This reward depends on the deck you choose, and each deck has a fixed reward. You will also get a penalty, which will cost you money. Penalties are somewhat random; the penalty you will get is different for different cards in the deck. Sometimes the penalty will be zero, and sometimes it will be larger, at times even larger than the reward you get for choosing that deck. You will start with a $2000 loan and you should try to get as much money as possible by the end of the study.

At the bottom of the screen, there is a graph which shows you your current earnings. The more money you have, the larger the bar will be. 
Now, you will begin the test.
Do you have any question? 
Touch to continue

This program reproduces the neuropsychological tests called "Iowa gambling task", described for the first time in: 
 BECHARA, A., DAMASIO, A.R., DAMASIO, H. e ANDERSON, S. (1994), Insensitivity to future consequences following damage to human prefrontal cortex. Cognition, n. 50, pp. 7-12. 

This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs 3.0 Unported. To view a copy of this license, visit:
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/3.0 or send a letter to Creative Commons, 171 Second Street, Suite 300, San Francisco, California, 94105, USA. 
This program is distribuited "As Is" in the hope that it will be useful, but WHITOUT ANY WARRANTY. 

The libraries used for the chart are available:
http://www.achartengine.org 

The libraries used to save the pdf files are available:
http://itextpdf.com/itext.php


Thanks to The working group for the chart icons in the menu:
http://blog.twg.ca/2010/11/retina-display-icon-set


Thanks to Honza Dousek for the Save-Pdf and Save-Csv icons in the menu: 
https://www.iconfinder.com/Lexter


Thanks to David Bellot for the cards: 
http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Card_back_01.svg


Thanks to Rodrigo Hohl for the Portuguese translation.



Explanation of the required permissions: 
1)Storage: the device can save a PDF file on the sd card. 
2)Hardware controls: the device can vibrate.


If you find bug, you want send same suggestions or request custom app, feel free to contact:
zsimolabs@gmail.com

This app is designed to run the "Iowa Gambling task" on smartphone and tablet with Android. 
On startup, after the screen to enter the name of the subject, you will see a brief explanation of the experiment. 
We chose to not include in this app material about theoretical or technical details concerning this procedure in order to avoid the risk of influencing the experimental subjects. For information, please refer to the article which this application is based: 
BECHARA A., DAMASIO A.R., DAMASIO H. e ANDERSON S. (1994), Insensitivity to future consequences following damage to human prefrontal cortex. Cognition, n. 50, pp. 7-12. 

The interface has been simplified by removing the task bar on the screens in which the subjects use the terminal, so that they are not distracted by the contents of the terminal. At the end of the procedure, pressing the menu button, the researcher can see 2 charts containing a summary of the results, save a PDF file and a CSV file with all the raw data. The files will be saved to the sd card of the device in the folder named "iowa"; the name of the files will be: "iowa" + the first two letters of subject name + the date. Device with Android Eclair 2.1 (api level 7) or previous can save 2 PNG files with charts instead of the PDF file.


In the settings menu you can select the experimental options (not present in the above-mentioned article) such as: associate a sound or a short vibration (vibration is not avaible on Motorola Xoom) to winnings and losses, show the progression of the selections.


Version 1.7 introduced the ability to export all the data recorded in a CSV file; the data are:
 - participant's name
 - trial number
 - selected deck
 - reward
 - penalty
 - net gain
 - total earned
 - response time (the interval in milliseconds between trials)
 - pressure put on display (if enabled)
 - pressure style (if enabled)
 - touch speed (for how many milliseconds the finger is in contact with the display)
 - time
 - date
Short vibration if the penalty is larger than the reward
Play sound if the penalty is larger than the reward
Play sound even if the reward is larger than the penalty
This application is free and without advertising. If it is helpful and if you deem it appropriate, you can contribute to the work of the developer making a donation.
Enter what you want to donate (in EURO) and click on the yellow button below

1.7.2: 
Fixed bug in the order of the labels in the first chart. 
Fixed month number in the name of the files starts from 0.


1.7.1: 
Better support to Portuguese. 
Minor fixes.


1.7: 
Save raw data in a CSV file.


1.6: 
Added support to the Portuguese language. 
Thanks to Rodrigo Hohl for translation.


1.5: 
Optimized for Kindle Fire and tablet with 7-inch screen. 
Added possibility to move the app to the SD card. 
New graphical interface.


1.4: 
As suggested by a user, increased the size of the graphs in the pdf file. 
Improved definition of menu icons. 
Improved volume control. 
Fixed misprints.


1.3: 
In order to help the researcher to study this test, it is now possible to display the progression of the selections.


1.2: 
The application, maintaining the previous features, is now free: we have chosen to promote the diffusion and circulation in order to be able to improve it and validate it through a larger number of feedback. For those who deem it appropriate, we have introduced the possibility of making a donation.


1.1: 
Added sound and vibration (vibration is not available for Motorola Xoom).
Shows the progression of the selected cards
Detecting the style of the touch on touch screen devices

Some experimental measurements are introduced in order to detect the touch style of the subjects: the pressure on the screen, the pressure style, the touch speed.

The pressure measurement on Android is device dependent: not all devices support the pressure detection and devices that support can be calibrated differently and return different values.
When supported, the value is normalized to a range from 0.0 to 1.0, although values higher than 1.0 may be generated depending on the calibration of the input device.
The pressure can be measured in two moments: when the finger begins the contact with the screen and when the finger stops the contact: the data saved in the CSV file is the average of these two values. When not supported, always returns the value 1.0.

Moreover, for every touch, it is recorded a second measure called "Pressure style" which can take only three values: LOW_HIGH (when the initial pressure of the the touch is less than the final pressure), HIGH_LOW (when the initial pressure is greater than the final) and EQUAL (when the two pressures are equal).

To detect the style of the touch with a measure separated from the pressure, and therefore available on any device, is recorder the "Touch speed": for each touch, for how many milliseconds the finger is in contact with the screen.


Summing up, the use of data related to the pressure may have value only if the device supports the detection of the pressure and the test is performed by all the subjects using the same device. 
Therefore, recording and saving the pressure in the CSV file is an option that should be enabled in the Settings menu (is not recorded by default).


For testing and understanding these measures, you can select the option of displaying in the home screen a button that detects and displays the Pressure, the Pressure style and the Touch speed.
Show the button to test pressure in the main screen
Summary of the data saved in the CSV file
